home.title: AI & Digitalization Consultant
home.subtitle: Your SME's guide to AI and digital transformation
home.duration: The consultation process typically takes 30-60 minutes depending on team size.

processOverview.title: How It Works
processOverview.subtitle: A structured 6-step process to identify the right AI project for your company
processOverview.whoIsThisForDesc: Small and medium-sized businesses exploring AI and digitalization - no technical expertise required!
processOverview.whatYouGetDesc: A concrete AI project proposal with business case, cost estimate, and implementation roadmap
processOverview.timeCommitmentDesc: 30-60 minutes for the full consultation, or complete steps over multiple sessions
processOverview.prerequisitesDesc: Basic information about your company (size, industry, current challenges). You can upload documents or let us crawl your website.

llmConfig.title: AI Configuration
llmConfig.hint: Click to configure your AI provider (required for AI-assisted brainstorming)

features.step1Desc: Tell us about your company, then assess your digital maturity using the acatech Industry 4.0 framework (5 min)
features.step2Desc: Generate AI ideas using the proven 6-3-5 creativity method - with AI assistants helping you (15-20 min)
features.step3Desc: Vote on the best ideas using an Impact vs Effort matrix to find quick wins (5 min)
features.step4Desc: Define clear objectives using CRISP-DM, the industry-standard framework for AI projects (10-15 min)
features.step5Desc: Build a compelling business case with ROI estimates to get management buy-in (5-10 min)
features.step6Desc: Download your complete consultation results as a professional PDF report

restoreSession.description: Or continue a previously saved session:

step1.title: Step 1: Company Profile
step1.subtitle: Provide company information and assess your digital maturity

explanation.title: Why we need this information
explanation.description: Understanding your company helps us generate relevant AI and digitalization ideas tailored to your specific situation. The more context you provide, the better the recommendations will be.
explanation.bullet1: Share your business model - what products or services do you offer?
explanation.bullet2: Describe your customers and target market
explanation.bullet3: Mention current challenges you face in daily operations
explanation.bullet4: Include information about your team size and main processes
explanation.tip: You don't need technical knowledge! Just describe your business as you would to a new colleague.

textForm.title: Add Text Information
textForm.label: Describe your company
textForm.placeholder:
Enter information about your company, such as:
- Business model and main products/services
- Target market and customer segments
- Key performance indicators (KPIs)
- Current challenges and opportunities
- Strategic goals and vision
- Team size and structure
textForm.hint: Provide as much detail as possible to help us understand your company.

fileUpload.title: Upload Document
fileUpload.dragDrop: Click to upload or drag and drop

webCrawl.title: Crawl Company Website
webCrawl.hint: Enter your company's website or a page with relevant information (About Us, Company Profile, etc.)
webCrawl.tip: Tip: The crawler will extract the page title, meta description, headings, and main content. For best results, provide a link to your "About Us" or company profile page.

companyInfo.title: Collected Information
companyInfo.addInfo: Add information using the forms above

step1a.title: Step 1a: Company Overview
step1a.subtitle: Provide information about your company through text, document uploads, or website crawling

explanation.title: Why we need this information
explanation.description: Understanding your company helps us generate relevant AI and digitalization ideas tailored to your specific situation. The more context you provide, the better the recommendations will be.
explanation.bullet1: Share your business model - what products or services do you offer?
explanation.bullet2: Describe your customers and target market
explanation.bullet3: Mention current challenges you face in daily operations
explanation.bullet4: Include information about your team size and main processes
explanation.tip: You don't need technical knowledge! Just describe your business as you would to a new colleague.

step1b.title: Step 1b: Digital Maturity Assessment
step1b.subtitle: Evaluate your company's Industry 4.0 readiness using the acatech Maturity Index

explanation.title: What is the acatech Maturity Index?
explanation.description: The acatech Industry 4.0 Maturity Index is a standardized framework developed by the German Academy of Science and Engineering. It helps organizations understand their current digital transformation status and identify areas for improvement.
explanation.bullet1: Rate your company across 4 key dimensions on a scale of 1-6
explanation.bullet2: Level 1 (Computerization) to Level 6 (Adaptability) represents increasing digital maturity
explanation.bullet3: The assessment helps identify specific areas where digitalization can have the most impact
explanation.bullet4: Your results will be used to tailor AI recommendations to your current maturity level
explanation.tip: Answer honestly based on your current state, not where you hope to be. This helps us provide realistic recommendations.

maturityLevels.computerizationExample: Example: You use Excel, email, and basic software but data is scattered
maturityLevels.connectivityExample: Example: Your systems are connected (ERP, CRM) and can share data
maturityLevels.visibilityExample: Example: You have dashboards showing real-time KPIs across the company
maturityLevels.transparencyExample: Example: You understand WHY things happen through data analysis
maturityLevels.predictiveCapacityExample: Example: You can predict future outcomes (demand, failures, trends)
maturityLevels.adaptabilityExample: Example: Systems automatically adapt to changes without human intervention

levelReference.title: Maturity Level Reference
levelReference.levelGuide: Level 1-2 = Early stage (most SMEs), Level 3-4 = Intermediate (data-driven), Level 5-6 = Advanced (AI-powered)

resources.title: Resources
resources.description: Digital capability of your workforce, equipment, materials, and tools
resources.q1: How digitally skilled is your workforce? (1 = basic computer use, 6 = AI/data science capabilities)
resources.q2: How connected and smart are your equipment and machines? (1 = manual, 6 = fully autonomous)
resources.q3: How well are your materials and inventory tracked digitally? (1 = paper-based, 6 = real-time IoT tracking)
resources.q4: How advanced are your digital tools and software? (1 = basic office, 6 = AI-powered enterprise systems)

informationSystems.title: Information Systems
informationSystems.description: Integration of IT systems and data processing capabilities
informationSystems.q1: How integrated are your IT systems? (1 = isolated silos, 6 = fully integrated ecosystem)
informationSystems.q2: How accessible is your business data? (1 = hard to find, 6 = real-time dashboards everywhere)
informationSystems.q3: How automated is your data collection? (1 = manual entry, 6 = automatic from all sources)
informationSystems.q4: How advanced is your data analysis? (1 = spreadsheets, 6 = AI/ML predictive analytics)

culture.title: Culture
culture.q1: How open is your organization to change? (1 = resistant, 6 = actively seeking innovation)
culture.q2: How well does knowledge flow across departments? (1 = siloed, 6 = open collaboration culture)
culture.q3: How is failure treated? (1 = punished, 6 = seen as learning opportunity)
culture.q4: How committed is leadership to digitalization? (1 = skeptical, 6 = strategic priority)

organizationalStructure.title: Organizational Structure
organizationalStructure.q1: How agile are your teams? (1 = rigid hierarchies, 6 = self-organizing teams)
organizationalStructure.q2: How fast can you make decisions? (1 = weeks/months, 6 = real-time data-driven)
organizationalStructure.q3: How do teams collaborate across functions? (1 = rarely, 6 = cross-functional by default)
organizationalStructure.q4: How quickly can you adapt to market changes? (1 = very slow, 6 = immediate pivots possible)

step2.title: Step 2: 6-3-5 Brainstorming
step2.subtitle: Interactive brainstorming session with AI assistants

explanation.title: What is 6-3-5 Brainstorming?
explanation.description: The 6-3-5 method (also called 'Brainwriting') is a proven creativity technique invented by Prof. Bernd Rohrbach. It's designed to generate many ideas quickly while building on each other's thoughts.
explanation.howItWorks: How it works: 6 participants × 3 ideas × 5 minutes × 6 rounds = 108 potential ideas in 30 minutes!
explanation.bullet1: Round 1: Write 3 fresh ideas on an empty sheet (5 min)
explanation.bullet2: Rounds 2-6: Receive someone else's sheet and add 3 new ideas that build on what you see
explanation.bullet3: AI assistants fill empty seats so you can run a full session even alone
explanation.bullet4: No idea is too small - 'automate email responses' or 'digitize paper forms' are great starting points!
explanation.exampleIdeas: Example ideas: 'Use AI to predict machine maintenance needs', 'Chatbot for customer FAQs', 'Automate invoice processing', 'Dashboard for real-time KPIs'
explanation.tip: Think about: repetitive tasks, communication bottlenecks, data you wish was easier to access, or decisions that take too long.

fallbackClustering.title: Simplified Grouping
fallbackClustering.message: Ideas were grouped automatically because AI clustering was unavailable. You can still vote and select a focus area.

explanation.title: Step 3a: Choose a Focus Area
explanation.description: Your brainstorming ideas have been automatically grouped into 'clusters' - categories based on the underlying technology or concept (e.g., 'Predictive Maintenance', 'Customer Service Automation', 'Process Optimization').
explanation.whatAreClusters: What are clusters? The AI analyzed all ideas and grouped similar ones together. For example, 'predict machine failures' and 'monitor equipment health' might form a 'Predictive Maintenance' cluster.
explanation.bullet1: Review each cluster - click to see the ideas within
explanation.bullet2: Use the matrix to find 'Quick Wins' (high impact, low effort) in the top-left quadrant
explanation.bullet3: Allocate your 3 points: give more points to clusters you find most promising
explanation.votingGuide: Voting guide: 3 points = 'This is my top choice', 2 points = 'Strong interest', 1 point = 'Worth considering'
explanation.tip: Consider which technology area would have the biggest impact on your business while being realistic about your resources.

phase1.generateHint: The AI will analyze your ideas and group them by technology or concept
phase1.voteHint: Click + to add points to clusters you want to explore
phase1.ideasLoadingError: Could not load idea details. Try regenerating clusters.
phase1.votesRecorded: Your cluster votes have been recorded! Select a cluster to continue.

explanation.title: Step 3b: Choose the Best Idea
explanation.description: Now prioritize the individual ideas within your selected cluster. The top-voted idea will be the focus for the detailed consultation.
explanation.bullet1: Review each idea in this cluster carefully
explanation.bullet2: Allocate your 3 points to the ideas you find most promising
explanation.bullet3: The winning idea will proceed to the Business Understanding consultation
explanation.tip: Consider both impact (value it could create) and feasibility (can you actually do it?).

phase2.voteHint: Click + to add points to ideas you want to pursue

voting.clickToAdd: Click + to add points to ideas you like

scatter.title: Cluster Prioritization Matrix
scatter.subtitle: Click on clusters to vote. Colors indicate maturity fit.
scatter.quadrantQuickWinsDesc: High impact, low effort - Start here! These deliver fast results with minimal investment.
scatter.quadrantStrategicDesc: High impact, high effort - Worth the investment for major transformation, but requires planning.
scatter.quadrantFillInsDesc: Low impact, low effort - Nice-to-have improvements when you have spare capacity.
scatter.quadrantAvoidDesc: Low impact, high effort - Usually not recommended unless there are strategic reasons.
scatter.clickToVote: Click to vote for this cluster

step4.title: Step 4: Business Understanding
step4.subtitle: CRISP-DM guided consultation to understand business objectives and plan your AI project

explanation.title: What is CRISP-DM?
explanation.description: CRISP-DM (Cross-Industry Standard Process for Data Mining) is the industry-standard framework used by data scientists worldwide to plan AI and analytics projects. It has 6 phases - we focus on Phase 1: Business Understanding, which is critical for project success.
explanation.phases: The 6 CRISP-DM phases: (1) Business Understanding → (2) Data Understanding → (3) Data Preparation → (4) Modeling → (5) Evaluation → (6) Deployment
explanation.bullet1: Business Objectives: What problem are you solving? What does success look like? (e.g., 'Reduce customer complaints by 20%')
explanation.bullet2: Situation Assessment: What resources do you have? What constraints exist? What data is available?
explanation.bullet3: AI/Data Mining Goals: Translate business goals into technical objectives (e.g., 'Build a model to predict customer churn')
explanation.bullet4: Project Plan: Define realistic phases, milestones, and responsibilities
explanation.tip: Answer honestly based on your current situation. There are no wrong answers - this conversation helps us understand your specific context and create a tailored project plan.

manualEntry.title: Manual Idea Entry Required
manualEntry.message: Please enter at least one idea to proceed with the consultation.
manualEntry.atLeastOne: Please enter at least one idea

step5.title: Step 5: Business Case & Cost Estimation
step5.subtitle: Evaluate potentials and estimate costs for your AI project

explanation.title: What is a Business Case?
explanation.description: A Business Case is a document that justifies why your company should invest in this AI project. It answers the question: 'What's the return on investment (ROI)?' We use the 5-level value framework to identify concrete benefits.
explanation.whyItMatters: Why does this matter? Without a business case, projects often fail to get funding or management support. A clear ROI argument turns 'nice idea' into 'approved project'.
explanation.bullet1: Level 1 - Budget Substitution: Replace costly external services (e.g., 'Save €50k/year on manual data entry outsourcing')
explanation.bullet2: Level 2 - Process Efficiency: Automate repetitive tasks (e.g., 'Save 10 hours/week on report generation')
explanation.bullet3: Level 3 - Project Acceleration: Speed up time-to-market (e.g., 'Launch products 3 months faster')
explanation.bullet4: Level 4 - Risk Mitigation: Prevent costly errors (e.g., 'Avoid €100k quality defects with predictive QC')
explanation.bullet5: Level 5 - Strategic Scaling: Grow without proportional cost increase (e.g., 'Handle 2x orders with same team')
explanation.tip: Rough estimates are fine! 'Approximately €30k-50k savings' is better than no number at all. We'll help you develop these estimates.

costsExplanation.title: Understanding Project Costs
costsExplanation.description: Getting a realistic cost estimate helps you plan your budget and set expectations with stakeholders. We'll break down costs into initial investment, recurring costs, and total cost of ownership.
costsExplanation.bullet1: Initial Investment: Development, integration, and training costs (one-time)
costsExplanation.bullet2: Recurring Costs: Cloud infrastructure, licenses, API usage (monthly/yearly)
costsExplanation.bullet3: Maintenance: Updates, monitoring, support (15-20% of initial annually)
costsExplanation.bullet4: Total Cost of Ownership: Full 3-year cost projection for budgeting
costsExplanation.tip: Cost varies significantly based on complexity. A quick win might cost 5k-15k, while enterprise solutions can exceed 150k.

chat.startMessage: The AI consultant will help you develop a business case using the 5-level value framework.

step6.title: Step 6: Results
step6.subtitle: Review findings and export your consultation report

explanation.title: DMME Methodology: From Business to Technical Understanding
explanation.description: You've completed the Business Understanding phase. The Technical Transition Briefing prepares the handover to the next phase: Technical Understanding & Conceptualization, where technical experts analyze data sources, systems, and implementation approaches.
explanation.bullet1: Review all collected findings from your consultation journey
explanation.bullet2: Generate a Technical Briefing that translates business needs into technical questions
explanation.bullet3: The briefing identifies enablers, blockers, and hypotheses for implementation
explanation.bullet4: Export a comprehensive PDF report for stakeholders and technical teams
explanation.tip: The Technical Briefing is designed for IT/OT managers or external consultants who will develop the technical solution.

incomplete.businessCase: No business case generated. Complete Step 5a.

incomplete.transcripts: No conversation transcripts yet. Complete the consultation steps.
